abstract.text: Take measurements, set device options, and query device properties

inlineContent.text: Once the device is connected and in an idle state, it is possible to take measurements:
to take measurements in all modes supported by the device. This is the recommended option.
to take measurement in only the specified scan modes. In most cases, this will not speed up the measurement cycle time, so this is not recommended.
The measurement operation is asynchronous and will return immediately. While the measurement is in progress, no other commands can be sent to the Nix device
Results of the measurement operation are provided in the
closure specified when starting the measurement. This closure provides two arguments:
A dictionary containing the measurement values as
objects. The keys of this dictionary correspond to the
below for notes on interpreting the measurement data.
The supported scan modes for a particular device are provided in the
list, or can be checked by calling
. The expected results by device are shown below:

content.text: Performing in-field profiling / calibration with reference tile

inlineContent.text: Certain device types support in-field profiling or calibration using a provided reference tile. This process requires first decoding a string from the QR code attached to the reference tile and then directing the user to measure the same tile. Any necessary adjustments/corrections are performed internally by the SDK and/or the Nix device firmware itself.
The in-field calibration procedure may be performed as often or seldom as desired by the user. However, the property
flag indicates whether or not in-field calibration is recommended for the connected device.
This flag is updated after each regular measurement
This flag is determined automatically by both elapsed time and ambient temperature change
indicates whether or not a connected device supports this feature. The expected result by device are shown below:
Decode the QR code printed on the device reference tile and interpret as a string. Do not parse this data further.
Check if the parsed data is valid using
. If valid, continue to the next step.
Instruct the user to place the device on the reference tile.
Using the decoded tile string, run the in-field calibration routine using
This operation is asynchronous and returns immediately. While the operation is in progress, no other commands can be sent to the Nix device (wait for the callback)
will result in a closure with either a success or error code.

inlineContent.text: options. These options are set to be enabled by default (if supported) and do not usually need to be changed:
A summary of device support is shown below, but can be checked at runtime (see notes above).
Changing any of these options may require communication with the device itself and is an asynchronous operation, with the status of the operation provided via a

protocol defines other fixed properties that can be read once the device has connected and reached an idle state. These include, but are not limited to:
: status of external power connection / charging
: indicates whether or not this device provides spectral data
: indicates whether or not this device provides density data
: list of supported reference white values provided by the measurement data from this device

properties indicate whether or not the hardware device is capable of providing these data types. However, these measurements will only be available if these features are enabled by the current license. See

abstract.text: M2 conditions (ISO 13655)
Helper to check if a particular scan mode is supported by this device (i.e. - checks if the mode is present in the
list). This value is valid only after a connection has successfully been opened.
Enum to describe the measurement modes used by Nix devices
Set the value for
. This method is asynchronous and will return immediately.

Flag to indicate if in-field calibration is recommended for this device at this time (if supported). This value is only valid after opening a connection and is a function of both time and ambient temperature. This value also updates each time a measurement is completed.

Start field calibration using provided reference tile, if supported. Upon executing this command, the scan of the reference tile will begin immediately. The user MUST be prompted to place the device onto the reference tile BEFORE this method is executed. This method is asynchronous and will return immediately.
This command requires data from the reference tile QR code. As the format varies between different device types, the string data should be provided exactly as decoded from the QR code.
Check if the formatting of the reference tile string data matches the expected format for this device, or
if the device does not support this feature.
